edu.stanford.math.plex4.interop

Class Plex3Stream

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.interop.Plex3Stream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractFilteredStream<Simplex>, java.lang.Iterable<Simplex>

    public class Plex3Stream
extends java.lang.Object
implements AbstractFilteredStream<Simplex>
    This class is a wrapper around a plex 3 SimplexStream that implements the AbstractFilteredStream interface of plex 4.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

    • Method Detail

      • finalizeStream

        public void finalizeStream()
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFilteredStream
        This function prepares the stream for use by a consumer, such as the PersistentHomology class. After finalization, the stream cannot not be modified by adding or removing elements. In practice, the finalize procedure will probably do some sorting and construction of data structures necessary for iterating through the stream.
        Specified by:
        finalizeStream in interface AbstractFilteredStream<Simplex>

      • getBoundary

        public Simplex[] getBoundary(Simplex basisElement)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFilteredStream
        This function returns the elements in the boundary of the supplied basisElement, without the coefficients. We do not integrate the elements of the boundary array with their respective coefficients since this interface is designed to be independent of the algebraic environment.
        Specified by:
        getBoundary in interface AbstractFilteredStream<Simplex>
        Parameters:
        basisElement - the element to get the boundary of
        Returns:
        an array containing the boundary elements of the queried element

      • getBoundaryCoefficients

        public int[] getBoundaryCoefficients(Simplex basisElement)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFilteredStream
        This function returns the coefficients of the boundary of the supplied basis element. Note that in many cases, this will be the standard array consisting of alternating signs: [1, -1, 1, -1, ...]. However, this will not always be the case. Thus this must be left abstract. Also note that the coefficients will always be integers.
        Specified by:
        getBoundaryCoefficients in interface AbstractFilteredStream<Simplex>
        Parameters:
        basisElement - the element to get the boundary coefficients of
        Returns:
        an array containing the boundary coefficients of the queried element
